Description: One of a pair of gold earrings, set with a black glass seal engraved with a head of Athena wearing a crested Corinthian helmet; the ring is S-shaped with chased or incised parallel grooves along the hoop ending in a single large globule; the gem is held in place with a small concave plate on the bottom and a binding of gold wire which is twisted several times around the ring at the top; the gem is cracked across the front.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2677)
Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (2779)
